intro: Cardaminopsis arenosa var. borbasii, commonly known as the Borbasii rockcress, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. This variety is distinguished by its hairy, basal leaves and compact growth habit, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
